content: flower potholders for 2011 potholder swap by jennifer martin this is how i make my potholders- it is similar to the gehaekelte topflappen but more of an adaptation please let me know if you have any questions or comments- via ravelry pm user bluej or email below finished size 7 5 aprox 9cm in diameter supplies hobby lobby i love this cotton solids 100g 165m/180yds us size f hook 3 75mm yarn needle plastic or bone ring optional gauge is not essential- it s more important to have a tight fabric than to get the exact dimensions if using thinner yarn repeat row 6 once more and adjust joining instructions accordingly front and back make 2 1 starting with a magic loop chain 3 and double_crochet 15 in loop join with slip_stitch 15 sts 2 chain 3 2dc in each double_crochet around join with slip_stitch 30 sts 3 chain 3 * double_crochet in next double_crochet 2 double_crochet in next double_crochet repeat from * around join with slip_stitch 45 sts 4 chain 3 double_crochet in same st chain 1 2dc in same st * skip 2 sts 2dc chain 1 2dc in next st repeat from * around join with slip_stitch then slip_stitch 2 more sts in order to end the round in a chain 1 space 15 shells 5 chain 3 double_crochet in same st chain 1 2 double_crochet in same st * 2dc chain 1 2 double_crochet in next chain 1 space repeat from * around join with slip_stitch slip_stitch 2 more to end round in chain 1 space 6 chain 3 2dc in same st chain 1 3dc in same st * 3dc chain 1 3 double_crochet in next chain 1 space repeat from * around join with slip_stitch slip_stitch 3 more to end round in chain 1 space 7 chain 3 6dc in same st * 7dc in next chain 1 space repeat from * around join with slip_stitch fasten_off weave ends in joining front & back the petals are made while joining outlining the edges then going towards the middle through front and back make sure the right side is facing out on front and back line up the edges pull up a loop in between two of any of the shells chain 1 * single_crochet in next 7 sts making sure to go through both layers single_crochet in between the 2 shells chain 1 single_crochet around the row below in between the same 2 shells you just did only on row 6 chain 1 single_crochet around row 5 chain 1 single_crochet around row 4 there are 2 skipped sts available i single_crochet into the closest one chain 1 then single_crochet into the other chain 1 single_crochet around row 5 chain 1 single_crochet around row 6 chain 1 single_crochet around row 7 repeat from * around until you arrive where you started single_crochet around a plastic or bone ring then fasten_off alternately you could chain your own hook or leave it off entirely weave in ends
